tit.j: 京都市道183号衣笠宇多野線

sen.j: 京都市道183号衣笠宇多野線（きょうとしどう183ごうきぬがさうたのせん）は、京都府京都市北区 (京都市)鹿苑寺前交差点より京都市右京区福王子交差点に至る主要地方道である京都市町村道。
sen.e: Kinugasa-Utano-sen, Kyoto City Road 183 (Kyoto-shido 183-go Kinugasa-Utano-sen) is a major local road that extends from Rokuon-ji-mae Intersection (Kita Ward, Kyoto City) to Fukuoji Intersection (Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City).
Kinugasa-Utano-sen, Kyoto City Road 183 is a major local road that extends from Rokuon-ji mae Intersection (Kita Ward, Kyoto City) to Fukuoji Intersection (Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: 読みの括弧書きは不要と考え削除しました。ハイフンを削除しました→Rokuon-ji mae
sen.e: Kinugasa-Utano-sen, Kyoto City Road 183 is a major local road that extends from Rokuon-ji mae Intersection (Kita Ward, Kyoto City) to Fukuoji Intersection (Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 別名は鞍馬口通、木辻通、一条通。
sen.e: It is also known as Kurama-guchi-dori, Kitsuji-dori, and Ichijo-dori.
It is also known as Kuramaguchi-dori, Kitsuji-dori, and Ichijo-dori.
sen.cmt: ハイフン削除しました→Kuramaguchi-dori
sen.e: It is also known as Kuramaguchi-dori, Kitsuji-dori, and Ichijo-dori.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）に開通して以来「観光道路」と呼ばれていたが、1991年（平成3年）に地元の運動により愛称を公募の結果、「きぬかけの路」と命名され定着している（第59代宇多天皇が真夏に雪見をしたく、衣笠山 (京都府)（＝きぬかけの山）に絹を掛けたと伝えられる故事にちなむ）。
sen.e: It was opened in 1963 and called 'Kanko-doro (Tourist's road)' at first, however, from 1991 it have been called 'Kinukake-no-michi (Draped silk road)', which had been chosen at the nickname contest that had been held on the local request. (The name 'Kinukake' originates from an anecdote: The 59th Emperor Uda wanted to see snow in high summer and his followers draped ('kake') many white silks ('kinu') over a nearby mountain, Mt. Kinugasa (aka Kinukake-no-Yama, Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: It is famous that the Kyoto Basin is hot and humid as hell in high summer, besides emperors can’t take off gorgeous dresses, so Uda wanted to cool himself by fooling his own eyes.
sen.e: It was opened in 1963 and called 'Kanko-doro' (Tourist's road) at first, however, from 1991 it have been called 'Kinukake no michi' (Draped silk road), which had been chosen at the nickname contest that had been held on the local request (the name 'Kinukake' originates from an anecdote: The fifty-nineth Emperor Uda wanted to see snow in high summer, so his followers draped many white silks over Mt. Kinugasa [Kyoto Prefecture] [also known as Kinukake no yama, literary, the mountain draped with silks] to make up a similar scene of snowy mountain).
sen.cmt: 全角の’を半角にしました。括弧の位置を訂正しました。ハイフン削除しました→Kinukake no michiピリオドの位置を訂正しました。(the 小文字にしました。数字をスペルアウトしました。:以降文章訂正しました。括弧内括弧を［］に訂正しました。
sen.e: It was opened in 1963 and called 'Kanko-doro' (Tourist's road) at first, however, from 1991 it have been called 'Kinukake no michi' (Draped silk road), which had been chosen at the nickname contest that had been held on the local request (the name 'Kinukake' originates from an anecdote: The fifty-nineth Emperor Uda wanted to see snow in high summer, so his followers draped many white silks over Mt. Kinugasa [Kyoto Prefecture] [also known as Kinukake no yama, literary, the mountain draped with silks] to make up a similar scene of snowy mountain).

sen.j: 当初の通称「観光道路」から明らかなように、観光地の間をつなぐ連絡道路の性格が強い。
sen.e: As the former nickname suggests, it connects many major tourist spots.
As the former nickname suggests, it connects many major tourist spots.
As the former nickname suggests, it connects many major tourist spots.

sen.j: 沿道には観光客向けの土産物店や飲食店が並ぶ。
sen.e: Along the road, there are many gift shops and restaurants for tourists.
Along the road, there are many gift shops and restaurants for tourists.
Along the road, there are many gift shops and restaurants for tourists.

sen.j: 観光シーズンには観光バスや自家用車などで混雑する。
sen.e: During tourist season, traffic congestion often occurs by sightseeing buses and cars.
During tourist season, traffic congestion often occurs by sightseeing buses and cars.
During tourist season, traffic congestion often occurs by sightseeing buses and cars.

sen.j: 京都市北区 (京都市) - 右京区
sen.e: Kita Ward (Kyoto City), Ukyo Ward (Kyoto City)
Kita Ward (Kyoto City), Ukyo Ward (Kyoto City)
Kita Ward (Kyoto City), Ukyo Ward (Kyoto City)

sen.e: Kuramaguchi-dori, Kyoto kanjo-sen Belt Line, Kyoto City Road 181 (Nishioji-dori)
